definition: PET, positron emission tomography (medical imaging method)
pinyin: zheng4 dian4 zi3 fa1 she4 ti3 ceng2

sentences.english: It was a very difficult first step to accept the positron.
sentences.chinese: 接受正电子是艰难的第一步。

sentences.english: The samples were also analyzed by slow positron implantation spectroscopy (SPIS).
sentences.chinese: 同时还使用了慢正电子注入谱来分析样品的微结构。

sentences.english: Later, electron and positron pairs were actually produced in laboratory experiments.
sentences.chinese: 之后，电子与正电子对也最终在实验室中被制造出来。

sentences.english: This creates, as it were, electron and positron shadows .
sentences.chinese: 这样也就有了电子和正电子的阴影。

sentences.english: The workable region for a spectrometer was divided into 42 small regions.
sentences.chinese: 将正电子寿命谱仪的可工作能区分成42个小块。

sentences.english: The positrons that are generated will move around in the material.
sentences.chinese: 这些正电子将沿着材料周围运动。

sentences.english: A photomagnetic positronium annihilation model was proposed to explain the experimental facts.
sentences.chinese: 提出正电子素光磁湮没模型以解释实验事实。

sentences.english: It needed some years of development by the experimenters before the fact of the existence of positrons was established.
sentences.chinese: 确立存在正电子这个事实还需要几年的实验发展。

sentences.english: The antielectron, or positron, was discovered in 1932.
sentences.chinese: 反电子或正电子，是在1932年被发现。

definition: neutrino (particle physics)/also written 微中子[wei1 zhong1 zi3]
positron/also called 正電子|正电子[zheng4 dian4 zi3]

pinyin: fang4 she4 xing4 tong2 wei4 su4
